did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Third Presbyterian Society of Starkey records, 1813-1924.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Third Presbyterian Society of Starkey (Rock Stream, N.Y.)

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Annual meeting minutes of the church and society and session meeting minutes which record admissions, baptisms, marriages, deaths and church disciplinary cases.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Third Presbyterian Society, an offshoot of the Eddytown Society, was organized February 25, 1833. The church was also known as the Rock Stream Presbyterian Church. It wasn't until 1869 that a committee was appointed to draft a confession of faith. In 1864 the building was moved and used as a storehouse. A new church was built on the original site the same year.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Annual meeting minutes of the church and society (1873-1924) and session meeting minutes which record admissions, baptisms, marriages, deaths and church disciplinary cases (1833-1867).
